title: Fat Duck chef sues for £200,000 after claiming kitchen tasks gave her RSI
text:
With dishes such as bacon and egg ice-cream and snail porridge previously served up to diners at The Fat Duck, Heston Blumenthal's Michelin-starred restaurant, visitors may wonder what exactly goes on in its kitchen.

Now a pastry chef has lifted the lid on the "arduous" efforts involved in preparing the experimental menu offerings at one of Britain's most renowned eateries.

Sharon Anderson, 28, is suing The Fat Duck Ltd for over £200,000 amid claims she has become plagued by crippling repetitive strain injury (RSI) as a result of her time in the kitchen.

The High Court heard Ms Anderson was pushed too hard to create Blumenthal's eccentric dishes at the restaurant in Bray, Berkshire, which left her suffering with chronic wrist pain.

Her tasks included placing up to 400 sweets a day into small bags using tweezers, making chocolate playing cards in a race against time before it set, and administering hundreds of tiny fingertip pinches to mushroom logs.

The restaurant has denied all fault for her injuries, adding the preparations carried out by Ms Anderson were commonplace in "fine dining restaurants".

Ms Anderson of Letterkenny, Co Donegal, is suing the restaurant on the grounds on alleged negligence, arguing the work given to her was "too fast, arduous and repetitive".
